result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark C Walls-Sawchuk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to report to the Clerk of Courts office by 2:00 pm, Monday, 2/22/16 to fill out probation paperwork and report to probation office.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Maintain full-time employment as directed by probation agent.
No contact with the victim, R.H.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: Stayed. To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted and sentence can be served in any county that will accept him. Defendant is responsible for notifying the Door County Jail if sentence is being served in a different county.

charges.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

defendant.name: Walls-Sawchuk, Mark C

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from defendant asking court to lift condition of his probation that he maintain full-time employment.  Court responds - the conditions of full-time employment is to insure payment of court financial obligations and restitution, if any. You still have financial obligations to the court of $537. Not restitution was ever ordered. If those court obligations are paid, I will take up your request to change the full-time employment conditions. DTE

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mark C Walls-Sawchuk in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea.  Defendant stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.  State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Defendant apologizes to the court. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Mark C Walls-Sawchuk in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.  Atty Reetz requests another status in a couple weeks with the hopes the matter will resolve then.  Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 08:45 am.
on State's motion to admit other acts evidence and motion to allow statements of defendant's wife to law enforcement despite spousal privilege
State's Rebuttal to Defense Response Regarding Admitting Other Acts Evidence and Allowing Statements of Defendant's Wife to Law Enforcement Despite Spousal Privilege
to Motion to Admit Spousal Testimony
to Motion for Other Acts Evidence

Defendant Mark C Walls-Sawchuk in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews motions filed by Atty Reetz.  Atty Reetz feels this case is close to resolving, asks court to remove from the trial calendar. Atty Reetz would like a little more time to work things out with ADA Korb. State has no objection to removing trial from the calendar. Court removes 1/05/16 trial from the calendar, sets status. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
State's Motion to Admit Other Acts Evidence and Motion to Allow Statements of Defendant's Wife to Law Enforcement Despite Spousal Privilege
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Set for pretrial and trial.  Bond remains as is.

Defendant Mark C Walls-Sawchuk in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 8/24/15 by Officer Bilodeau. (fingerprint card destroyed 2/24/16)
No contact direct or indirect with R.H.   To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Mark C Walls-Sawchuk in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
